key_requirements: Economic activity must substantially contribute to at least one of the six environmental objectives
Activity must not significantly harm any of the other environmental objectives (DNSH principle)
Activity must comply with minimum social safeguards
Activity must meet technical screening criteria established by Commission delegated acts
Activities must align with net-zero trajectory by 2050
Financial and non-financial undertakings must disclose proportion of environmentally sustainable activities
Mandatory disclosure requirements for large companies and financial market participants

compliance_standards.name: Equator Principles
compliance_standards.category: Project Finance Environmental and Social Risk Management Framework

principles.name: Review and Categorisation
principles.description: EPFIs review and categorise proposed projects into Category A (high risk), Category B (medium risk), or Category C (low risk) based on environmental and social risks

principles.name: Environmental and Social Assessment
principles.description: Borrower must conduct Environmental and Social Assessment (ESA) addressing relevant risks and impacts. EP4 requires dedicated Climate Change Risk Assessment and Human Rights Assessment for Category A and some Category B projects

principles.name: Applicable Environmental and Social Standards
principles.description: Assessment process must address compliance with host country laws, applicable international standards including IFC Performance Standards and World Bank Group EHS Guidelines (for both Designated and Non-Designated Countries under EP4)

principles.name: Environmental and Social Management System and Equator Principles Action Plan
principles.description: For Category A and B projects, borrower must develop Environmental and Social Management System (ESMS) and Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) to address identified risks

principles.name: Stakeholder Engagement
principles.description: Borrower must demonstrate effective stakeholder engagement as ongoing process involving affected communities. For Category A and some Category B projects, requires free, prior and informed consultation

principles.name: Grievance Mechanism
principles.description: ESMS must include grievance mechanism to receive and facilitate resolution of concerns about environmental and social performance. Must be scaled to risks and adverse impacts of project

principles.name: Independent Review
principles.description: For Category A and B projects, independent Environmental and Social Consultant reviews Assessment Documentation and proposes action plan for compliance with Equator Principles

principles.name: Covenants
principles.description: EPFI includes covenants in financing documentation requiring compliance with ESMP, remediation of non-compliance, provision of periodic reports, and decommissioning plans where applicable

principles.name: Independent Monitoring and Reporting
principles.description: For Category A and some Category B projects, borrower retains independent Environmental and Social Consultant to verify monitoring information. EPFI requires periodic reports on compliance

principles.name: Reporting and Transparency
principles.description: EPFIs must report publicly at least annually on Equator Principles implementation, including transactions reaching Financial Close. Borrowers must generate project-specific sustainability reports

project_categories.description: Projects with potential significant adverse environmental and social risks and/or impacts that are diverse, irreversible, or unprecedented

Projects with potential limited adverse environmental and social risks and/or impacts that are few in number, generally site-specific, largely reversible and readily addressed through mitigation measures
Projects with minimal or no adverse environmental and social risks and/or impacts

key_ep4_enhancements: Dedicated Climate Change Risk Assessment requirement
Expanded application to both Designated and Non-Designated Countries
Broader coverage of financial instruments and lower thresholds
applicable_financial_products: Project Finance (including project finance loans and project-related corporate loans)

adoption_statistics.description: 110 Equator Principles Financial Institutions (EPFIs) in 38 countries have officially adopted the Equator Principles

ep4_key_innovations: Dedicated Climate Change Risk Assessment aligned with TCFD recommendations
Assessment of both physical risks (direct damage, supply chain impacts) and transition risks (policy, legal, reputational)
Enhanced Indigenous Peoples' rights protection and FPIC requirements
Application of IFC Performance Standards to both Designated and Non-Designated Countries
Expanded scope of covered financial products
Strengthened requirements for sensitive projects in high-income OECD nations

transition_risks: Policy and legal risks from national policy changes
climate_risk_assessment_requirements.alignment: Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) recommendations

compliance_standards.name: UN Principles for Responsible Investment
compliance_standards.organization: United Nations-supported Principles for Responsible Investment (PRI)

principles.name: ESG Integration
principles.description: We will incorporate ESG (environmental, social, and governance) issues into investment analysis and decision-making processes

principles.name: Active Ownership
principles.description: We will be active owners and incorporate ESG issues into our ownership policies and practices

principles.name: ESG Disclosure
principles.description: We will seek appropriate disclosure on ESG issues by the entities in which we invest

principles.name: Industry Promotion
principles.description: We will promote acceptance and implementation of the Principles within the investment industry

principles.name: Collaboration
principles.description: We will work together to enhance our effectiveness in implementing the Principles

principles.name: Reporting
principles.description: We will each report on our activities and progress toward implementing the Principles

key_requirements: Annual reporting through PRI Reporting Framework
Transparency on responsible investment activities and progress
Integration of ESG factors into investment decision-making
Engagement with investee companies on ESG issues
Collaboration with other signatories and stakeholders
Continuous improvement in responsible investment practices
signatory_types: Asset owners (pension funds, insurance companies, sovereign wealth funds)
Service providers (consultants, data providers, research firms)

reporting_framework.name: PRI Reporting and Assessment Framework
components: Signatory reporting on responsible investment activities

compliance_characteristics: Obligation to report annually on implementation extent
Focus on continuous improvement and transparency

alignment_notes: IFC Performance Standards are widely referenced by Equator Principles as applicable environmental and social standards
EBRD Environmental and Social Requirements align closely with IFC Performance Standards structure
EU Taxonomy minimum social safeguards reference international standards including IFC PS
Equator Principles EP4 requires application of IFC Performance Standards for both Designated and Non-Designated Countries
UN PRI signatories often reference other frameworks (EBRD, IFC, EP) in their responsible investment policies
infrastructure_finance_relevance: All frameworks are extensively used in infrastructure project finance
Equator Principles specifically designed for project finance transactions
IFC Performance Standards are de facto standard for infrastructure projects globally
EBRD standards apply to infrastructure projects in emerging markets and transition economies
EU Taxonomy provides classification system for sustainable infrastructure investments
UN PRI principles guide institutional investors in infrastructure asset allocation
